alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 6:31PM EDT until July 25 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Androscoggin County in southwestern Maine... * Until 930 PM EDT. * At 631 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lewiston, Auburn, Mechanic Falls, Greene, Leeds, Minot, Sabattus, Wales, Poland and Monmouth. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
